title: Suspect in Colorado fire attack planned for a year, FBI says
summary: Suspect in Colorado fire attack planned for a year, FBI says . Mohammed Sabry Soliman, 45, is charged with a federal hate crime as well as state charges of attempted murder and assault . Suspect appeared in court via a video feed from the Boulder County Jail for less than five minutes .

title: Al-Qaida affiliate attacks Mali army bases as junta struggles to contain jihadist threat
summary: An al-Qaida-linked group has launched an assault on a Malian army base in Timbuktu . The attack comes a day after it claimed responsibility for another attack near the border with Burkina Faso . As many as 30 soldiers were killed in the attack .

title: What did Elon Musk get from DOGE – and what’s next?
summary: DOGE brought Silicon Valley-style disruption to Washington, consolidating federal data and dismantling oversight . Musk is expected to channel what he gained into a private AI venture – with public systems still in reach .

title: Russian and Ukrainian chief negotiators held secret private meeting
summary: Vladimir Medinsky and Rustem Umerov held an unannounced bilateral meeting that helped prepare the general session of talks between Moscow and Kiev . The private conversation lasted around two and a half hours, an anonymous source told RT . The two sides also agreed to their largest prisoner-of-war exchange to date .

title: US nuclear deal offer allows Iran to enrich uranium — media
summary: The proposal would allow limited low-level uranium enrichment on Iranian soil for a to-be-determined period of time . White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt "did not deny any of the details of the proposal described to Axios," only saying that the US administration "will not comment on details"  Iran's underground enrichment facilities will have to become 'non-operational' for a period of time agreed by the parties . Iran would have to halt new research and development on centrifuges .

title: Satellite lofted for first Arab country
summary: A Chinese-made communications satellite became the first "export" of such a spacecraft to an Arab country . President Xi Jinping and his Algerian counterpart Abdelaziz Bouteflika exchanged congratulatory messages on Monday morning . Xi Jinping said China is willing to work with Algeria to strengthen exchanges and cooperation in various fields .

title: ‘Time of Great Opportunity’ for U.S. and India: Usha Vance
summary: U.S.-India Strategic Partnership Forum’s (USISPF) Leadership Summit in Washington DC . Usha Vance, whose parents are from Andhra Pradesh, said that she had a personal relationship with India . India and the U.S. are in the throes of negotiating the first phase of a Bilateral Trade Agreement .

title: Jonathan Joss shot dead: Neighbors say actor used to do weird things, had history of feud with killer
summary: Sigfredo Alvarez Ceja, the suspected killer of actor Jonathan Joss, has been charged with felony first-degree murder . Alvarez shot and killed the actor when the duo had an argument, neighbors said . The shooting took place at Joss's former home in Texas which was burned down earlier this year .

title: World News in Brief: Guterres condemns antisemitic attacks, ILO to debate pros and cons of working online, Sudan, Ukraine updates
summary: A man was arrested in Boulder after reportedly using a flamethrower and Molotov cocktails to set people on fire at an event in support of Israeli hostages in Gaza . The suspect reportedly yelled “Free Palestine” during the attack and now faces federal hate crime charges . In Paris, vandals targeted the Shoah Memorial, three synagogues and the Jewish restaurant Chez Marianne .

title: How the FBI and Big Ag Started Treating Animal Rights Activists as Bioterrorists
summary: The government–industry fearmongering has accelerated with the spread of COVID . A coalition of transparency and animal rights groups released that letter, along with a cache of government documents, to highlight the tight links between law enforcement and agriculture industry groups . The FBI defends its relationship with “members of the private sector” in a statement .
